-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | An implementation of high performance, minimal statistics functions
--   
--   This package is obsolete. Please use O'Sullivan's <i>statistics</i>
--   package: <a>http://hackage.haskell.org/package/statistics</a>
@package statistics-fusion
@version 1.0.1


-- | Description :
--   
--   A collection of commonly used statistical functions designed to fuse
--   under stream fusion, with attention paid to the generated assembly.
--   
--   These are high performance replacements for various list functions,
--   implemented in pure Haskell using stream fusion for sequences.
--   
--   To illustrate the performance gap, consider the task of calculating
--   the numerically stable mean of a sequence of 1e9 double values.
--   
--   Using the standard list implementation provided by the hstats package,
--   
--   <pre>
--   $ time ./mean 
--   3.141592653589793
--   ./mean  26.80s user 0.08s system 99% cpu 26.965 total
--   </pre>
--   
--   And this package,
--   
--   <pre>
--   $ time ./mean                      
--   3.141592653589793
--   ./mean  5.59s user 0.00s system 99% cpu 5.606 total
--   </pre>
module Math.Statistics.Fusion

-- | A numerically stable mean.
--   
--   required.
mean :: Vector Double -> Double

-- | The harmonic mean
harmonic :: Vector Double -> Double

-- | The geometric mean of a non-negative list.
geometric :: Vector Double -> Double

-- | A numerically stable variance.
var :: Vector Double -> Double

-- | The standard deviation.
stddev :: Vector Double -> Double
